description: The Chrysler Corporation posted a $202 million profit today for its third quarter, more than reversing its loss in the corresponding period a year ago.

title: Jordan's Flip-Flops Almost Rival On-Court Leaps
description: If Michael Jordan doesn't start getting his stories straight, his nickname may soon have to be amended to Hot Air.

title: U.N. May Have to Close a Key Relief Warehouse
description: The United Nations military headquarters here dispatched an armed rescue mission today to a village 50 miles to the northwest where eight United Nations relief workers were trapped by fierce street fighting between Croatian forces and troops of the Bosnian Government.

title: Philip Kuehn Dies; G.O.P. Official, 72, Vied to Be Governor
description: Philip G. Kuehn, who twice lost narrow elections for governor of Wisconsin, died Sunday at home in Picayune, Miss. He was 72 years old.

title: First Beijing Visit for Hong Kong's Governor
description: Hong Kong's new Governor, Christopher Patten, arrived here today on his first official visit, opening the curtain on what is likely to be a quarrelsome five-year relationship with Chinese officials over the degree of democracy in the territory.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Shura Cherkassky Pianist 92d Street Y

title: Clinton and Bush Agree on Trimming Armed Forces, but Their Paths Vary
description: President Bush and Gov. Bill Clinton agree that the United States military in the post-cold war era should be a smaller force prepared to respond quickly to regional contingencies with the most advanced weaponry.

title: Werner Torkanowksy, a Soloist On Violin and a Conductor, 66
description: Werner Torkanowsky, a conductor, composer and violinist, died on Tuesday at Mount Desert Hospital in Bar Harbor, Me. He was 66 years old and lived in Hancock Point, Me.

title: Theater in Review
description: The Madame MacAdam Traveling Theater Actors' Playhouse 100 Seventh Avenue South (at Grove Street) Greenwich Village By Thomas Kilroy; directed by Charlotte Moore; set design, David Raphel; lighting design, Kenneth Posner; costume design, David Toser; sound design, James M. Bay; production stage manager, Pamela Edington; piano music performed by Rusty Magee. Presented by the Irish Repertory Theater Company, Charlotte Moore and Ciaran O'Reilly and One World Arts Foundation, W. Scott McLucas, executive director. WITH: Ellen Adamson, W. B. Brydon, Denise duMaurier, Rosemary Fine, Michael Judd, Fiona McCormac, Brian F. O'Byrne, Denis O'Neill, Ciaran O'Reilly and Michael O'Sullivan.

title: THE 1992 CAMPAIGN: Political Memo; Which Debate System Worked Best? It's a Debate
description: Now that the nation has survived an assault by campaign debate, certain truths about debate tactics can be passed along to the next generation:

title: Compaq Posts a $49.4 Million Profit
description: In a strong sign that its strategy of being a maker of low-cost personal computers is working, the Compaq Computer Corporation today reported a profit of $49.4 million, or 61 cents a share, for the third quarter, compared with a loss in the corresponding quarter a year ago.

title: Big New Study Finds No Link Between Fat and Breast Cancer
description: TO the immense disappointment of cancer experts, a study of more than 89,000 women has found no evidence that a diet low in fat or high in fiber protects against breast cancer.

title: McDonnell Said to Plan Cut in Output
description: In the latest setback for the McDonnell Douglas Corporation, orders for its MD-11 wide-body jet have slowed so much in the last six months that the company is planning to cut production at least 40 percent in 1994, major subcontractors and analysts say.

title: In Long Run, Family Leave Will Be a Bargain; The Children Tell Us
description: To the Editor:

title: In Race for Congress, a Clash of Mavericks
description: The candidates seated behind the red-white-and-blue-draped table in a Staten Island church basement had barely finished their opening remarks in a recent debate when a man identifying himself as a retired police officer jumped up with a question.

title: UST Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
GTE Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 4,000,000 and $ 17,000,000, or 2 cents a share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and the 9 months also included a one-time charge of $ 204 million related to the merger with Contel and a gain on the transfer of certain cellular properties.

title: W. A. Cullman, 77, A Marketing Expert And an Ex-Educator
description: W. Arthur Cullman, a retired educator and executive who was a marketing expert, died on Sunday during a visit to Manhattan. He was 77 years old and lived in Columbus, Ohio.

title: BellSouth Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $ 40,700,000 related to the refinancings of $ 550 million in bonds at more favorable interest rates for both the quarter and 9 months.c-Included a charge of $ 35.4 million from the change in an accounting method.

title: Alex. Brown Profit
description: Alex. Brown & Sons Inc. said third-quarter profits surged 39 percent as investment banking and trading revenue showed double-digit increases. The securities firmsaid profits advanced to $11.1 million, or 71 cents a share, from $8 million, or 51 cents a share, a year earlier.

title: Administration Hides Nothing on Iraq
description: To the Editor:

title: Scott Paper Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes gains of 12 cents a share in the quarter and 36 cents a share in the 9 months from the net effect of accounting changes instituted at the beginning of 1992 related to depreciation and postretirement benefits.

title: Fighting Alcohol Abuse at Princeton Eating Clubs
description: If the best way to confront a problem is to come face to face with it, Princeton University's former "alcohol czar" may be onto something.

title: Critic's Notebook; The Politicizing of TV's Prime-Time Comedy
description: Nan Buffum (Mary Gordon Murray) is executive deputy director of the Bush-Quayle campaign. Her husband Whit (Gerrit Graham) works in a similar capacity for Clinton-Gore. Caught up in a personal swirl of political sniping and dirty tricks, they both want out of a marriage made in hell. Finally going before a judge, she snaps, "I'm the Republican, your honor. He's the ass."

title: U.S. Petroleum Data
description: In millions of barrels except refinery utilization

title: NBO Stores Dismisses Deutsch
description: NBO Stores Inc. in Fair Lawn, N.J., said it had dismissed Deutsch Inc. in New York, confirming a report this week in Adweek. Deutsch, NBO's agency since August 1991, had introduced an image campaign for the retail clothing chain that carried the theme "Men's values."

title: A Conrans Habitat Suitor
description: Marvin S. Traub, the former chairman and chief executive of Bloomingdale's department store, is leading an investment group that is considering buying Conrans Habitat, the home-furnishings chain, from Storehouse P.L.C.

title: Heavy Traffic Impedes Robbers' Getaway
description: Three armed men robbed a 39-year-old jewelry wholesaler of $350,000 in jewels yesterday on a busy street in Flushing, Queens, the police said. Minutes later, a police officer captured one of the men as the others fled and $150,000 in jewelry was recovered.

title: 'Yes/Oui' for Canada
description: With Toronto's Blue Jays in the World Series, America is suddenly paying more attention to its friendly northern neighbor. The timing is perfect. Canada is right now trying to define itself yet again, and the task is tortuous. America's interest is in a solution assuring that its most dependable ally and biggest trading partner will also be stable and strong.

title: Low U.S. Bond Prices Raise New York City's Cost of Debt
description: Prices went from bad to worse in the Treasury market yesterday, but a important bond sale did not go badly for New York City.

title: Avery Dennison Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Amgen Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: ON THE SET WITH Dick Van Dyke; All the Way From Rob Petrie And Back Again
description: DICK VAN DYKE, famous long ago in sitcom black-and-white, still looks limber in real-life color. Killing time on a stultifyingly humid Hollywood sound stage, the 67-year-old comedian is cracking up the crew between takes with the same kind of Silly Putty faces and Gumby-limbed contortions that made "The Dick Van Dyke Show," its last episode shot over a quarter-century ago, one of the most successful television comedies ever produced.

title: Miscellany
description: * The Federal Communications Commission, acting on a referral from the Children's Advertising Review Unit of the Council of Better Business Bureaus, has admonished the Philadelphia public television station WHYY for violating the commission's host-selling policy. The review unit had investigated an underwriting credit for the "Sesame Street Live" theatrical show that was shown at the end of a "Sesame Street" telecast on WHYY and featured several "Sesame Street" characters. The unit said the credit violated guidelines meant to prevent children from confusing programming and advertising.

title: Bucks' Vincent Sidelined
description: The newly acquired Milwaukee Bucks guard SAM VINCENT may be out for the season with a ruptured Achilles' tendon. Vincent was hurt last night during a 143-98 exhibition loss to the Seattle Supersonics in Omaha. (AP)

title: School Board Must Change, Union Says
description: The president of the powerful teachers' union yesterday joined critics calling for a change in how New York City's schools are governed, saying that bitter divisions on the seven-member Board of Education had convinced her that the current board should be replaced, either by a single commissioner or a panel chosen in a significantly different way.

title: U.S. Judge Bars Public From a Plea Hearing
description: A Federal judge denied public access yesterday to information at a criminal plea hearing in the Southern District Court of New York and ordered lawyers involved not to discuss the insider-trading case.

title: Marines Rally 'Round the Maple Leaf, Easing a Flap
description: In a stirring show of understanding, the United States Marines and the citizens of Canada buried the flap of the upside-down Canadian flag with gestures of goodwill tonight before Game 3 of the World Series.

title: Union Camp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an after-tax benefit of $ 40 million relating to the adoption of SFAS 106 and 109, and offset by a pretax charge of $ 57 million to establish a reserve to enhance workplace safety. These adjustments were recorded in the first quarter of 1992.

title: Difficult Balancing Act Of Watching the Police
description: For Barbara J. Attard, the hills of this beautiful city echo with ugly street stories of racial harassment, sexist remarks and bloody beatings.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Ensemble Rebel Corpus Christi Church

title: EASTERN COLLEGE REPORT
description: Syracuse

title: When Ailing Pastime Meets TV Recession, Baseball Gets the K
description: Even as CBS's broadcasts of the World Series provide a compelling video window on the best that major league baseball has to offer, executives of the sport are preparing to negotiate new television contracts that are expected to end the prosperity previously wrought by TV.

title: Godiva and Seagram Meet for a Drink
description: Godiva Chocolatier Inc. and Joseph E. Seagram & Sons Inc. are teaming to introduce a chocolate liqueur produced by the latter based on the candy made by the former.

title: Corrections
description: A headline in some editions of Business Day yesterday about the third-quarter financial report of the Grumman Corporation referred incorrectly to the result. The company reported a 6 percent drop in profit, not a loss.

title: Warner-Lambert Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a charge of $ 106 million on the adoption of SFAS 106.

title: Grief Spans Sea as Gun Ends a Life Mistakenly
description: The Halloween decorations -- a paper skeleton, a plastic ghost -- are still in place outside Rodney Peairs's neat brick ranch-style house near here, and a faint reddish stain is still outlined on the floor of the carport.

title: Allegheny Power Systems reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
BUSINESS DIGEST
description: Companies

title: CENTENAIRE BLANZY BUYS TWO SMALLER RATINGS AGENCIES
description: The French company Centenaire Blanzy, which publishes reports and ratings on some 370 banks and corporations in 21 countries, yesterday completed the acquisition of IBCA Ltd., headquartered in London, and Euronotation France S.A. of Paris. The acquisition -- made through a new French holding company, IBCA-Notation Groupe, which is 70 percent owned by Centenaire Blanzy -- makes it one of the world's major rating agencies and represents a large step toward creation of a European credit agency.

title: Leslie Fay Cos.  reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 3
description: b-Included after-tax gain of $ 2,563,000, or 13 cents a share, from sale of the company's Head Sports Wear business for both the quarter and 9 months.

title: Compaq Computer reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Reflects restructuring and other special charges and credits. Income from operations before restructuring and other charges and credits was $ 72 million in the latest quarter, an increase of 324 percent over $ 17 million in the corresponding period of 1991.Restructuring and other special charges totaling about $ 85 million pretax - which include separation costs associated with a reduction in employees, writedown of property, plant and equipment and a charge for early retirement of long-term debt - are also reflected in 1992 third quarter results.These charges are offset by a third quarter gain of about $ 86 million on the sale of the company's equity interest in Conner Peripherals. A restructuring charge of about $ 135 million pretax was included in third quarter 1991 results.c-Net loss

title: Maxxam Net Plunges 87.3%
description: Maxxam Inc.'s third-quarter net income plummeted 87.3 percent, to $700,000, or 7 cents a share, from $5.5 million, or 58 cents, a year earlier, largely because of price weaknesses at its Kaiser Aluminum unit.

title: Chrysler Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a charge of $ 101 million on the restructuring of the company's car rental operations for both the quarter and 9 months; and the 9 months also included a gain of $ 218 million on the adoption of new accounting rules related to income taxes.c-Net loss and the 9 months included a charge of $ 257 million on the adoption of a new accounting method for special incentive programs.

title: FMC Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $ 2,300,000 for the quarter and $ 11,400,000 for the 9 months, both related to restructuring of long-term debt.c-After an extraordinary charge of $ 9,200,000 related to restructuring of long-term debt for the quarter and 9 months.

title: A 'Stubborn' Brewery Stays Afloat
description: F. X. MATT is the kind of brewery that has been going out of business in the last few decades: small, family owned and battered by competition from the big companies like Anheuser-Busch and Miller Brewing.

title: Knicks Just a Memory To Cavaliers' Wilkins
description: Gerald Wilkins and the Knicks were staying in the same hotel today. For Wilkins, it was just another cold reminder of a seven-year relationship that ended much differently than he had hoped.

title: New Guidelines Established For Magazine Advertising
description: Concerned that readers are becoming confused, the American Society of Magazine Editors announced new guidelines today to differentiate between pages of advertising and editorial matter.

title: Flightsafety International Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a non-recurring pre-tax gain of $ 12.6 million from the sale of the company's financial interest in Aeroformation, a Toulouse, France joint venture with Airbus Industrie for both the quarter and 9 months.Corrected from yesterday's editions.

title: Tyco Toys Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included extraordinary charge of $ 390,000 from the early extinguishment of debentures.

title: 2 Writers Are Chosen For Poets' Corner
description: Edith Wharton and William Carlos Williams will be inducted into the Poets' Corner during the vespers service at 7 P.M. on Sunday at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, Amsterdam Avenue and 112th Street in Morningside Heights.

title: New Campaigns
description: * Look-alikes resembling Mikhail Gorbachev, Richard Nixon and other international political figures who have suffered the frustration "of having power one minute and losing it the next" are featured in television commercials and print advertisments for Millennium rechargeable batteries. The campaign, by Tausche Martin Lonsdorf, Atlanta, carries the theme "The power to last a lifetime," which is illustrated by a Queen Elizabeth II look-alike who uses Millennium in her tape player. * Neiman Marcus is introducing print advertisements intended to portray the retail chain as a pacesetter for fashion and style. The ads, created by the Richards Group, Dallas, carry a new corporate theme line, "Neiman Marcus. How To Look."

title: Campus Journal; Presidential Debate Raises Students' Self-Esteem at Michigan State
description: Students at Michigan State University live under a constant blue-and-maize shadow cast by their neighbors at the University of Michigan, often finding themselves obliged to explain that they attend that other school in Michigan.

title: Review/Dance; Pastiche of New Works by Ballet Chicago
description: Ballet Chicago has been directed since its founding in 1987 by Daniel Duell, once a leading dancer in the New York City Ballet. While still with that troupe, he began another career as a choreographer: one could have expected Ballet Chicago, as many troupes outside New York, to be dominated by the works of its director.

title: Wine Talk
description: IGNORE for a moment the busy Autostrada, and the view from the proud battlements of this ancient city cannot be much different from what it was at the outset of the 13th century when the young Giovanni Bernardone first saw it. He was captured during a war between Perugia and Assisi, and there, 10 miles to the east, perched on its own hill, Assisi can be seen today. To the west is Trasimeno, Italy's largest lake. Just over the horizon to the south is Montefalco, and beyond that, Orvieto.

title: Lead Levels Excessive In Water, E.P.A. Says
description: Lead in drinking water exceeds federally permissible levels in nearly 20 percent of the nation's largest cities, according to the first comprehensive test of municipal water supplies ever carried out by the Environmental Protection Agency.

title:
Real Estate;
An Old Sutton Place Hotel Is Taken Out of Mothballs
description: FOR more than a decade, a veil of scaffolding has hung over the vacant Sutton Hotel on East 56th Street near First Avenue as a legacy of the vain attempts of one owner after another to revive it.

title: Jays' Key Finally Gets a Starter's Call
description: Jimmy Key pitched in the Toronto bullpen day after day during the American League Championship Series, waiting for a call that he knew might never come. The starter, who was told before the series against Oakland that he would not be starting, was anxious and maybe even angry about being relegated to reliever.

title: DSC Communications reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net lossc-Included about $ 46.1 million and $ 55.1 million in non-cash charges for asset write downs, provisions for doubtful receivables and restructuring costs for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Theater in Review
description: The Men Are Afraid of the Women Ohio Theater 66 Wooster Street SoHo Through Nov. 1 By John Kaplan; directed by Dennis Delaney; scenic designer, Bennet Averyt; lighting designer, Adrienne Shulman; costume designer, Deborah Edelman; sound and technology director, Greg Rajczewski; stage manager, Colleen Davis; artistic director, Robert Lyons. Presented by Project III, in association with Waterfront Ensemble. WITH: Kevin Agnew, Tim Barrett, Dina Dillon, Funda Duyal, Joseph McKenna, Mary McLain and Jeff Morris. MUSIC: Jim Cooper, Ernie Muhlback and Mike Soga.

title: American General Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Giants Lacking a Big-Play Defense
description: The Giants struggle. They pout. They win one, lose one, or worse.

title: Vitamin as Muscle-Damage Fighter
description: ALONG with their training regimen and carbohydrate loading, participants in the forthcoming New York City Marathon might consider taking vitamin E, a new study suggests.

title: CHRONICLE
description: SHERRIE S. ROLLINS, who resigned as a top aide to President Bush when her husband, EDWARD J. ROLLINS, became a manager of the Perot campaign, went to work for MORTIMER B. ZUCKERMAN, the publishing and real-estate magnate on Monday.

title: WQXR-AM to Change Its Format, to Popular Music From Classical
description: WQXR-AM, one of the two classical music radio stations owned by The New York Times, plans to change its format to play American popular music. The plan was announced yesterday by Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, the chairman and chief executive officer of The New York Times Company.

title: Braves Are Running, But They're Running Out Of Games, Too
description: The Oakland Athletics did their best to run the Toronto Blue Jays ragged in the American League playoffs, with mixed results at best. But that does not mean that the Atlanta Braves weren't paying attention, tuning up their running game in time for the World Series.

title: Final Debate Tops Ratings
description: Defying expectations that the electorate was tiring of the Presidential debates, Monday's third and final debate scored the highest television Nielsen rating of this month's political debates.

title: Colgate Palmolive reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net lossc-Reflects a restructuring charge of $ 243 million for both the quarter and 9 months.The company said results for the latest quarter and nine months included those of Mennen, acquired in March.

title: Unisys Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included extraordinary income of $ 10 million, or 6 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 27 million, or 17 cents a share, in the 9 months, both from the effect of utilization of operating loss carryforwards.c-Net loss and the 9 months included a special charge of $ 1.2 billion.Revenue represented total revenues.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Atlantic Sinfonietta Merkin Concert Hall

title: FoxMeyer Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary tax credit of $ 1,600,000, or 7 cents a share, for the quarter and $ 3,486,000, or 15 cents a share, for the 6 months.FoxMeyer said its second quarter income per share figures were affected by its initial public offering during second quarter a year ago. In September 1992, FoxMeyer said it completed a 1.5 million-share repurchase of its common stock.The company also said Phar-Mor Inc., which filed for bankruptcy in August, owed it $ 72.4 million. The company said it has not taken a writeoff because it is 'continuing to assess this situation.'

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: WE'VE never met her but we love her. Whether the chic black, red and white tote bag being given away at Galeries Lafayette had anything to do with it is beside the point. Not too long ago an attractive middle-aged woman walked up to the desk set up to process applications for store credit cards. Marie Fabry overheard the following conversation:

title: Public & Private; Prevailing Winds
description: The beginning of the end came at a moment of great triumph. The sound is what I remember best about the State of the Union Message George Bush delivered to Congress on Jan. 29, 1991, just two weeks after the gulf war began -- the sound not of his voice but of the huzzahs, the cheers, the roars that interrupted him time after time. No matter that the speech was long on the self-congratulation of a country engaged in foreign conflict and very short on a domestic program. The room was stuffed to bursting with approval, like helium, threatening to levitate the man.

title: Shirley Booth, Star of TV, Radio, Stage and Screen, Is Dead at 94
description: Shirley Booth, an actress whose warmth and versatility brought her acclaim on stage, screen and television, died on Friday at her home in North Chatham, Mass. She was 94 years old.

title: Weyerhaeuser Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
description: b-Included a charge of $ 61 million from an adjustment in accounting.The company said that its pretax earnings included $ 25 million as the result of a partial settlement of a lawsuit for the refund of federal income taxes.

title: The Pop Life; Tribute To Dylan Is Slow To Pay Off
description: Last Friday's euphoric tribute to Bob Dylan at Madison Square Garden left a lot of people with the impression that the producers of the show had struck gold. Tickets were priced at $150 for industry insiders and up to $80 for the general public, there were two pay-per-view telecasts and the show was transmitted via television or radio to 68 countries. In the United States, roughly 160 radio stations carried the broadcast.

title: People
description: * John Sanders, 49 years old, co-president and chief executive at the Wunderman Cato Johnson unit of Young & Rubicam Inc., New York, was named to the new position of executive vice president at Y. & R., becoming worldwide account managing director on the Ford Motor Co. account. Succeeding him at Wunderman is Mitch Kurz, 40, who had been president at Wunderman Cato Johnson/North America.

title: The Hand's Shape: Unique and Useful For Identity Check
description: Problem: the use of stolen or counterfeit ID's or credit cards. Potential solution: a new system of identification based on measurements of the human hand.

title: Personal Health
description: MY brother and I never regretted that our parents' limited finances precluded a hefty dose of after-school lessons in this, that and the other activity. After school for us meant play time.

title: Savoring the Passion and the Mystery of Wild Mushrooms
description: WILD mushrooms, fragrant of the woods and fields where they are gathered, are nearing their autumn peak of abundance, but many people are daunted by the variety and mystery of this most multifarious of foods. Culinary sophistication and interest in natural and regional products are battling years of ignorance and the encroachments of technology, so it behooves consumers to know what they are eating.

title: Union Electric Co.  reports earnings for 12mos Sept 30
Jets Finding It Hard To Get Offense in Gear
description: In three seasons with the Jets, right guard Dwayne White has established quite a name for himself. At 6 feet 2 inches and 315 pounds, he has been nicknamed Road Grader, mostly for the help he has provided the Jets' running game and for his deployment as a blocking back in goal-line situations.

title: Theater in Review
description: Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris Village Gate 160 Bleecker Street Greenwich Village By Eric Blau. Production conception, English lyrics and additional material by Mr. Blau and Mort Shuman; based on Brel's lyrics and commentary; music by Jacques Brel, Francois Rauber, Gerard Jouannest and Jean Corti. Directed by Elly Stone; musical direction by Annie LeBeaux; additional movement by Gabriel Barre; scenery by Don Jensen; lighting by Graeme F. McDonnell; costumes by Mary Brecht; production supervised by Harry A. Kraus, Blue Curl Productions. Presented by Blue Curl Productions, in association with Phyllis Raskind, Harold L. Strauss and Stuart Zimberg. WITH: Gabriel Barre, Andrea Green, Joseph Neal and Karen Saunders.

title: In Long Run, Family Leave Will Be a Bargain; Women's Burden
description: To the Editor:

title: Coca-Cola Enterprises reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net lossThe company said pro forma results for the year-ago third quarter and 9 months, after adjusting for the December 1991 acquisition of Johnston Coca-Cola Bottling Group Inc., showed a net loss of $ 30 million on revenues of $ 1,311,000,000 and a net loss of $ 5 million on revenues of $ 3,841,000,000, respectively.

title: Several Drug Concerns Post Improved Earnings
description: Several pharmaceutical and health-care companies reported improved earnings yesterday, partly as a result of a strong demand for new products and a weak dollar that bolstered overseas revenues. In general, the companies' results were in line with analysts' expectations or exceeded them slightly.

title: Smith Corona Has Loss
description: The Smith Corona Corporation today posted a loss of $5.1 million for its first quarter, compared with net income of $4.1 million, or 14 cents a share, a year earlier. Sales declined 7.2 percent, to $81.2 million, from $87.2 million. The results in the latest quarter included a charge of $6.5 million, or 22 cents a share.

title: Schering-Plough reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included extraordinary loss of $ 26,700,000, and offset by gain of $ 27,100,000, or 13 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.

title: Tandy Profit Falls 23%
description: The Tandy Corporation today reported that net income dropped 23 percent in its first quarter to $32.1 million, or 40 cents a share, from $41.8 million, or 52 cents a share, in its first quarter last year. Revenue for the latest quarter, which ended on Sept. 30, increased 10.4 percent, to $1.16 billion from $1.05 billion a year ago.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-13 JAPAN'S SIMMERING SCANDAL With the smell of money and the tang of power, a meaty stew of speculation is bubbling in Japan over just how close the ties are between political leaders and mobsters. A1 DOUBLE DEATHS REMAIN A MYSTERY Petra Kelly, founder of Germany's Green Party, was shot by her companion, who then killed himself, the police said. The two former lawmakers were found dead in their house, with any motive a mystery. A3

title: Kimball C. Atwood 3d Dies at 71; Developed Way to Analyze Genes
description: Dr. Kimball Chase Atwood 3d, a geneticist who helped develop a technique for the detection and analysis of individual genes in a chromosome, died on Oct. 13 at his home in Woods Hole, Mass. He was 71 years old.

title: Tandy Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Johnson & Johnson reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
U.S. Surgical reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Former Devils' Return Silences the Boo-Birds
description: Sean Burke heard the jeers loud and clear during his first visit to New Jersey as a member of another team, but the towering goaltender and his Hartford teammates were the ones who were full of smiles at the end.

title: 60-Minute Gourmet
description: IT is no secret that pork is one of my favorite meats, not only for its versatility and flavor, but also for its healthful qualities. Pork today is considerably leaner than it was 20 years ago. It has less marbling because of new breeding techniques, and more of the fat is trimmed before it gets to market. Yet, the meat remains moist and flavorful in almost any kind of recipe.

title: DELTA LAYS OFF 103 PILOTS IN FIRST OF TWO FURLOUGHS
description: Delta Air Lines Inc. said yesterday that it would furlough 103 pilots beginning Dec. 1, in the first phase of "at least two" layoffs. A Delta spokesman could not provide a specific figure on how many additional layoffs the company would make, but Delta "does not anticipate that the second phase will exceed the first."

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: FEDERAL-MOGUL CORP., Detroit, a manufacturer of parts for automobiles and trucks, and TRW Inc. announced the completion of Federal-Mogul's acquisition of TRW's independent automotive aftermarket business.

title: A Plan by Frito to Outfox The Super Bowl Audience
description: IN January, Frito-Lay sponsored a special program on the Fox television network that competed against the halftime show during Super Bowl XXVI on CBS. The maker of snack foods like Fritos and Doritos wanted to offer the giant Super Bowl audience an alternative to what Frito-Lay denigrated as a banal spectacle of dancing snowflakes and salutes to gridiron greats.

title: Keeping a Chimney Clean (and Safe!)
description: A CRACKLING fire is a pleasure on a crisp autumn day, provided the smoke goes up a chimney that has been properly cleaned and inspected. "There's a killer attached to your house if you don't take care of it," said Dennis Smith, owner of Chimney Doctors, an 11-year-old company.

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt * Wisconsin Bell Inc., a unit of Ameritech Inc., has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for a shelf offering of up to $150 million of debt securities. * Federal National Mortgage Association plans to price a total of $1.3 billion in debentures today, with $800 million of an issue due in 1997, and $500 million of an issue due in 2002.

title: Ameritech Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included first-quarter gain of 10 cents a share from a settlement with the Internal Revenue Service.c-Included gain of $ 73.6 million from sale of a portion of the company's interest in Telecom Corp. of New Zealand for both the quarter and 9 months.

title: Knight-Ridder Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
Is Clinton Driving Bond Market?
description: Has the sharp fall of the bond market in October been a Clinton rout? And if so, was yesterday's sharp jump in Treasury prices -- with the 30-year bond up more than half a point -- a Clinton rally?

title: Moscow Resounding With the Thundering Hoofs of the Anti-Reform Posse
description: The debate over Russia's future has broken out into the open with a vengeance as an increasingly vocal opposition prepares for a bitter battle over President Boris N. Yeltsin's program of economic reform.

title: Market Place; Searching for Oil Beyond Moscow
description: WESTERN oil analysts have talked for years about the geological wonders of the area that used to be the Soviet Union, and how much oil could be produced there with modern technology, if only the right deal could be struck. So far, to their frustration, it has been mostly talk.

title: Heritage Media reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary charge from the extinguishment of debt of $ 1,513,000 for the quarter and $ 3,594,000 for the 9 months.c-After an extraordinary credit of $ 2,150,000, or 21 cents a share, for the quarter and $ 4,725,000, or 45 cents a share, for the 9 months.Latest quarter and 9 months' losses from continuing operations of $ 9,254,000 and $ 21,338,000 both included a pretax $ 2.7 million charge from the write-off of its investment in Supermarket Visions, a U.K. in-store marketing company.

title: Republic New York Net Up
description: The Republic New York Corporation said yesterday that its profits rose 16.7 percent in the third quarter. The banking company reported net income of $67.8 million, or $1.16 a share, compared with $58.1 million, or 99 cents a share, a year earlier.

title: Pop and Jazz in Review
description: Andrea Marcovicci Oak Room Algonquin Hotel 59 West 44th Street Through Jan. 30

title: With His King on the Run, Fischer Manages a Draw
description: After Bobby Fischer had pressed him positionally throughout the game, Boris Spassky not only escaped into a draw yesterday, but also spent the last 22 moves of the 80-move struggle torturing his opponent by chasing his king all over the board. Spassky was no doubt getting even for the games in which Fischer had done the same to him.

title: Heartland Express reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Garden Q. & A.
description: Dormant Oils

title: United Technologies Net Rose 19% in 3d Quarter
description: The United Technologies Corporation, the aerospace and technology giant, said yesterday that third-quarter earnings rose by 19 percent from year-earlier levels despite a sharp drop in profits at Pratt & Whitney, its jet engine division.

title: THE 1992 CAMPAIGN: Al Gore; Environment and Industry Can Flourish, Gore Says
description: A day after President Bush attacked his positions on the environment, Senator Al Gore called today for a "new industrial revolution" in which stricter environmental standards would oblige businesses to adopt more efficient technologies.

title: National Pizza Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 29
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Sports of The Times; Home Sweet Dome
description: OUTSIDE, it was chilly and windy. Too chilly for baseball like it oughta be. But in the snug Skydome last night, the Blue Jays kept building a nest for the latest World Series tradition: in the 10 games in domed stadiums the home-sweet-dome team has never lost.

title: Goulds Pumps Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Drugs Cost Less in Canada Than in U.S., Study Finds
description: The General Accounting Office released a study yesterday showing that the prices charged by Canadian subsidiaries of American drug companies were 32 percent lower than the same companies charged American customers.

title: INSIDE
description: New Israeli Peace Offer

title: Grey Quits At Bantam And Joins Ballantine
description: Linda Grey, who recently stepped down as head of Bantam Books to start her own imprint there, resigned from the company to become president and publisher of the Ballantine Publishing Group and an executive vice president of its parent, Random House Inc.

title: Kovalev's Goal Is October Revelation
description: Aleksei Kovalev dropped to his knees and pumped his hands at the roof. He looked like Jimmy Connors in a helmet, only considerably more European.

title: Canadian Occidental Petroleum reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: LAW FAILS TO STEM ABUSE OF MIGRANTS, U.S. PANEL REPORTS
description: The law Congress enacted six years ago to combat illegal immigration has done nothing to stop exploitation of migrant farm workers, one of its principal objectives, a Government-appointed, bipartisan commission has found.

title: The Jigsaw Puzzle Goes Vertical
description: JIGSAW puzzles have entered a new dimension. Wrebbit USA, a toy company in Carsonville, Mich., has introduced the "Puzz-3D" line, five three-dimensional puzzles in the form of Victorian mansions and a Bavarian castle, among others. The puzzles are meant for children, but adults may have to help. The challenge is to get children to use their spatial and visual abilities and build upward.

title: Bush: Mixing Harshness With Warmth
description: The Bush campaign began broadcasting three new commercials in local markets yesterday; the campaign would not specify which markets or the size of the buy. Two 30-second person-in-the-street advertisements attack Gov. Bill Clinton. A 60-second ad uses warm images to portray President Bush as a family man and a leader. ON THE SCREEN Opens with words in white on black background: "On Integrity. October. 1992."

title: MCI Posts 13.6% Net Gain; Ameritech Is Down 12.9%
description: The MCI Communications Corporation, the nation's second-largest long-distance carrier, reported yesterday that third-quarter net income had risen 13.6 percent and that telephone traffic, or how long its customers talk on its network, had risen nearly 15 percent.

title: Man Is Fatally Shot As Commuters Flee
description: A man was shot and killed and another man was critically wounded yesterday on a busy street in Jamaica, Queens, as rush-hour commuters fled for cover, the police said.

title: Digital Trims Its Severance Benefits
description: Reflecting its continuing financial troubles, the Digital Equipment Corporation today reduced the severance package that it is providing to employees who are laid off.

title: Black & Decker Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
description: Latest share earnings are after preferred dividend requirements of $ 2.9 million and $ 8.7 million for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: Marsh & McLennan reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago periods' share earnings included a gain of 12 cents a share relating to the realization of compensation received for services provided in connection with the organization and development of Centre Reinsurance Holdings Ltd.

title: Informix Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $ 407,000 which reflects gain on repurchase and retirement of convertible subordinated debentures for the quarter and 9 months.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Service Corp. International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $ 4.8 million income tax benefit in the quarter and 9 months.

title: MacDermid Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Will the 1-5 Jets Finally Draw a Line in the Turf?
description: Buffalo is not the kind of team that the Jets want to face with their guards down, or their tackles or center for that matter.

title: Israel Refines Golan Terms As Mideast Talks Resume
description: Israel said today that it had reformulated its proposal for territorial concessions in the Golan Heights in an effort to obtain a peace treaty establishing normal relations with Syria. But Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin's negotiators gave no details of their offer, so it was impossible to tell whether the latest package of Israeli ideas contained significant new proposals or just new wrapping.

title: RULING FAVORS TEXAS INSTRUMENTS AND MICRON
description: Texas Instruments Inc. and Micron Technology Inc. won a round yesterday in the memory chip trade wars when the Commerce Department said in a preliminary ruling that it would impose anti-dumping penalties against South Korean chip makers. The Commerce Department announced duties ranging from 5.99 percent to 87.4 percent on dynamic random access memory chips with a capacity of one million bits of information or more that are exported to the United States by three companies -- Gold Star, Hyundai and Samsung.

title: Mapco Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Teacher Asked To Be Shot, Police Charge
description: Distraught over a separation from her husband and a recent diagnosis of multiple sclerosis, a Brooklyn machine-shop teacher talked a 17-year-old student into bringing a gun to school last Friday and trying to kill her during a between-classes break, the authorities said yesterday.

title: Plum Creek Timber L.P.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included gain of $ 14.9 million, or 99 cents a share, from sale of the Gallatin unit and Belgrade Sawmill transaction, completed in July, in the quarter and 9 months.Share earnings are in units.

title: Foreign Affairs; A Bush Green Light to Iraq?
description: What President Bush did NOT say in the days immediately before Iraq's invasion of Kuwait on Aug. 2, 1990, illuminates the historical sky like an electrical storm. It puts into sharp relief Ross Perot's charge that Mr. Bush "in effect" or inadvertently gave Saddam Hussein the green light to attack.

title: PNC Financial Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Abkhazians Seek Freedom From Georgia; Outside Help Is Needed
description: To the Editor:

title: Consolidated Rail reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results for 1992 and 1991 are restated for a 2-for-1 split paid Sept. 15.

title: Trump Yields To Demand On Housing
description: The chairman and staff of the New York City Planning Commission have reached agreement on several significant issues with Donald J. Trump over his Riverside South development project.

title: ANGRY CIRCLE K BONDHOLDERS FILE PROPOSAL
description: Bondholders, angry that the Circle K Corporation's bankruptcy reorganization plan would pay nothing on the $515 million debt they hold, yesterday filed a proposal that would give senior creditors new preferred stock in the company and new long-term secured debt.

title: Jobs Bond Proposal Will Assist New York
description: To the Editor:

title: Exhibition for Children About Racism
description: ONE by one, the faces of three children fill a video screen. With simple words they tell powerful stories of contemporary American life.

title: Union Pacific Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss and after a special charge of $ 870 million, or $ 575 million after tax, related to operational restructurings, principally at Union Pacific Railroad, in the quarter and 9 months.

title: Correction Official Charged in Kickback Scheme
description: An assistant commissioner for the New York City Department of Correction was arrested yesterday on charges that he took $24,000 in kickbacks from a janitorial supply company for steering contracts its way.

title: AMR Lost $85 Million In Quarter
description: The AMR Corporation, which owns American Airlines, reported an $85 million loss for its third quarter yesterday, largely because of the summer air fare war that American escalated.

title: Resource Mortgage Capital reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Review/Dance; 'Aria,' a Bill T. Jones Premiere That Deftly Blends Contrasts
description: The dancers in the Bill T. Jones/ Arnie Zane Dance Company are among the best in American modern dance, beginning with Mr. Jones himself, Arthur Aviles, Sean Curran and Eric Geiger, to name the most obvious.

title: B.C. Soars to Higher Plane
description: This summer, Tom Coughlin wrote each of his Boston College football players a letter documenting last season's accomplishments and setting out the goals for the new year. Coughlin said he wanted the Eagles to be a good football team in September and a great football team in November.

title: Chrysler Campaign For New Models
description: The Chrysler Corporation yesterday introduced the extensive -- and expensive -- ad campaigns for three make-or-break models for 1993: the Chrysler Concorde, the Dodge Intrepid and the Eagle Vision. Estimates are that Chrysler will spend $80 million through year-end to advertise the cars, which carry the code name LH; they are crucial for reviving Chrysler's automotive sales.

title: Board's Bitterness Boils Over and Impedes Schools
description: What began months ago as a debate within the seven-member Board of Education over condoms and AIDS instruction appears to have reached a level of bitterness and mistrust that has begun to hamper the board's ability to oversee the running of New York City's schools.

title: Judge's Ruling Due Today On Daily News Ownership
description: A Federal bankruptcy judge is expected to rule today on whether Mortimer B. Zuckerman will become the new owner of The Daily News.

title: Brave Talk as Atlanta Faces the Exit
description: The Atlanta Braves know all about adversity, they swear they do. That's why, Sid Bream said, there was no gnashing of teeth, no soul-searching or tearing out of hair after they tumbled to within one defeat of being eliminated from the World Series after losing, 2-1, to the Toronto Blue Jays tonight.

title: Mellon Bank Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $ 76 million in gains on the sale of securities and an $ 18 million restructuring charge taken in connection with an expense reduction program, in the quarter and 9 months.The latest and year-ago 9 months' periods were after preferred dividend payments of $ 39 million in the latest period and $ 37 million in year-ago period.

title: USG Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a loss of $ 1 million from discontinued operations in the quarter and the 9 months included an after-tax charge of $ 20 million that was recorded in the second quarter of 1991 related to the September 1991 divestiture of DAP Inc.

title: Country Gardens In the City
description: "I GET my first crop -- green onions -- in March, and right now I've got Italian leaf broccoli," Charlotte Elsner said, barely hinting at the range of edibles she harvests from her South Philadelphia backyard. When it comes to living at least partly off the land, a surprising number of city folk do. As the autumn days dwindle, these backyard and rooftop farmers take justifiable pride in the fruits of labor that began in January when seeds were ordered and plots were planned.

title: Earnings Double at Conner
description: Conner Peripherals Inc., riding a wave of higher sales as a result of the price wars in the personal computer industry, said its third-quarter earnings more than doubled.

title: Review/Fashion; De la Renta in Paris (Saint Laurent, Too)
description: Now it's the Americans' turn. First came the Belgian, British, Italian, Japanese and Austrian designers, along with the French, to show their work on the runways here over the last 10 days.

title: Report Says Priest Worked Despite Abuse Complaints
description: The Bishop of the Roman Catholic diocese of Fall River, Mass., and other church officials removed the Rev. James R. Porter from his priestly duties at least eight times from 1964 to 1970 because he sexually molested children but repeatedly allowed him to resume work after receiving optimistic accounts of his treatment, The Boston Globe reported yesterday.

title: People
description: * Janice Doty was named to the new post of senior vice president of client development at McCracken Brooks, heading the newly opened New York office of the Minneapolis-based sales promotion agency. She had been director of direct marketing communications at I.B.M. United States, New York. * Warren Benjamin, an executive vice president at Saatchi & Saatchi DFS/Pacific, Torrance, Calif., was named to the new post of director of client services.

title: How to Grow Edible Plants
description: Many edibles are well suited to small spaces in or out of town. Good growing tips can be found in the following recent publications.

title: Ethyl Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included First Colony Life Insurance Co. unit's after-tax gains on investments of $ 23 million, or 19 cents per share, and $ 41.5 million, or 35 cents per share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.c-Included First Colony Life Insurance Co. unit's after-tax gains on investments of $ 4.5 million, or 3 cents per share, the quarter and $ 8.9 million, or 7 cents per share, for the 9 months.

title: Newell Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago periods' results were restated to include the merger with Sanford Corp., which has been accounted for as a pooling of interests.

title: Norwest Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Reflected a writedown of intangible assets of about $ 38 million, resulting in reduced net income by $ 34.3 million.

title: Republic New York Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
If Clinton Wants a Democratic Foreign Policy; Courage of Dissent
description: To the Editor:

title: Kimberly-Clark reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Cray Research reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Review/Theater; O Juliet, O Desdemona: Wherefore Is Everyone?
description: In the inverted world of "Goodnight Desdemona (Good Morning Juliet)," Juliet is standing on the ground delivering the balcony speech, not to Romeo but to a timid, time-traveling Canadian academic. The academic (Cherry Jones) is embarked on a literary mission to prove her theory that "Romeo and Juliet" and "Othello" were originally written as comedies, not tragedies, and magically she has found herself within the plays.

title: Review/Theater; Battling Over a Woman With No Say
description: Inspired by recent news articles about the custody battle between the parents of a young woman left comatose by an accident and the woman's lover, Paul Walker's "Under Control" is a rambling and often self-indulgent play that is given a generally compelling performance by a well-chosen cast under the crisp direction of Jonathan Silver.

title: Tax-Exempt Funds Off; Taxable Yields Are Up
description: Yields were mixed in the latest seven-day period ended yesterday, as IBC/Donoghue's Money Fund Report surveyed more than 862 tax-exempt and taxable money market funds. Tax-exempt funds had lower yields, while taxable funds posted slight gains.

title: Washington Water Power reports earnings for 12mos Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 2,403,000, or 10 cents a share, in latest year and $ 1,650,000, or 7 cents a share, in year-ago period.

title: Challenges Mounting for G.M. Chief
description: Whether Robert C. Stempel stays or is removed as the chairman and chief executive of the ailing General Motors Corporation, his effectiveness is waning.

title: THE 1992 CAMPAIGN: The Independent; PEROT INTENSIFIES HIS AD CAMPAIGN
description: Capitalizing on the momentum he generated in the three Presidential debates, Ross Perot began making the case today in a barrage of new television and radio advertisements that a vote for him would not be wasted.

title: When Anderson Struts, the Bulls Take Notice
description: It was 24 minutes of one game that didn't count, but Kenny Anderson gave the Chicago Bulls enough of a preview for several of them to hold up two world-champion thumbs.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: AIRBUS INDUSTRIE, said that China Eastern Airlines had ordered five Airbus A-340 planes for flights to the United States and other long-distance destinations. BOEING DEFENSE & SPACE GROUP announced it has selected General Electric Co. to supply engines for the 767 Airborne Warning and Control System, or AWACS, aircraft.

title: U.S. Archivists to See Hanoi's Files on Missing
description: American archivists will travel to Vietnam at the end of this month to begin reviewing documents and photographs from Hanoi's files to help resolve questions about the fate of missing American servicemen, Administration officials said today.

title: Robert W. MacGregor; Union Official, 76
description: Robert W. MacGregor, a former union official and Labor Commissioner for Nassau County, died on Monday at his home in Coram, L.I. He was 76 years old.

title: Ruling May Make Suits Against Insurers Easier
description: A Federal Appeals Court in Chicago has ruled for the first time that homeowners in poor neighborhoods who believe they are victims of redlining by insurance companies can sue insurers under Federal housing law.

title: The Cold War: Get Over It
description: Despite all the public preoccupation with the economy, George Bush and Bill Clinton have had plenty to say about foreign policy. The problem is that most of it looks backward. By failing to talk about America's future role in the world, whoever wins on Nov. 3 is missing the chance to claim popular support for needed change.

title: Bundesbank: Sound Money Bastion
description: Should European monetary union some day become a reality, one of the world's most powerful and influential institutions -- the Bundesbank -- will be consigned to the dustbin of history.

title: THE 1992 CAMPAIGN: The Republicans; President, After 10 Cool Months, Is Catching Fire as a Campaigner
description: As President Bush likes to say, this is a weird election year, and now comes the latest surprise: after 10 torpid months, Mr. Bush has suddenly reawakened as a fist-shaking, stem-winding Presidential candidate.

title: UNR Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a recovery of $ 8.1 million after-tax, or 18 cents a share, from a litigation settlement reached in June 1992. That represents the present value of payments due over a three-year period, net of certain costs.UNR said that it has unrecorded net operating loss carryforwards of about $ 150 million from the extraordinary charges included in the 1989 statement of income. The company said that to date, these charges were deducted for income tax purposes to the extent expenditures were actually made by its asbestos disease claims trusts.The company said about $ 26.8 million and $ 2.8 million of expenditures have been made by the trust in the first 9 months of 1992 and 1991, respectively.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Jackson Weaver, 72, Voice of Smokey Bear
description: Jackson J. Weaver, a radio personality in Washington and for 45 years the voice of Smokey Bear, died there on Tuesday at Holy Cross Hospital. He was 72 years old.

title: Clorox Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 19,061,000 from adoption of SFAS 106.

title: U.S. HOPE DASHED ON GLOBAL TRADE
description: The Bush Administration's lingering hopes for a pre-election breakthrough in world trade talks collapsed today as negotiations in Brussels broke down, leaving American and European officials much farther apart than before on trimming farm subsidies.

title: Grove Tries Again
description: CALVIN GROVE, a champion once, thought he lost a title by "cold-blooded robbery." Now he's just a contender, determined to reclaim what he considers rightfully his: a world boxing championship. His obstacle on Nov. 7 in Lake Tahoe, Nev., will be AZUMAH NELSON of Ghana, the heavy-hitting three-time champion in two weight divisions who will be defending his World Boxing Council superfeatherweight title.

title: Democrats: Courting the Younger Generation
description: The Democratic National Committee on Tuesday began a $1 million advertising campaign aimed at younger voters. The 30-second spots, one feature a young man and the other a young woman, are appearing on the networks, geared to shows with younger audiences like "Beverly Hills 90210" and "Roseanne." ON THE SCREEN White letters on black background: "A reality check. Jonathan."

title: Noranda Forest reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Corestates Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $ 1,500,000, or 3 cents a share, for the quarter and $ 4,500,000, or 9 cents a share, for the 9 months.The gain in the year-ago quarter and 9 months reflect adoption of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 109, Accounting for Income Taxes (FAS 109).The bank is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: THE 1992 CAMPAIGN: Issues -- The Drug Problem; Candidates Seek Little Change in Antidrug Efforts
description: After nearly 20 years of failed efforts to solve the nation's drug problem with fast boats, helicopters, door-busting police raids and the world's largest prison system, both major candidates for the Presidency are proposing more of the same.

title: Wells Fargo & Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
First Data Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.The company said its net revenues for the 9-month period in 1992 increased because of the purchase of FDR Limited in July 1991.On Sept. 30, First Data bought EFTEL Holdings Ltd., which operates an electronic funds transfer network in Australia.

title: Giants Begin Overhaul By Releasing Walls
description: As soon as he heard Ray Handley's recorded voice on the answering machine saying "call me," Everson Walls knew the Giants had released him.

title: Books of The Times; A Heroic Then, a Realistic Now
description: Memories of the Ford Administration By John Updike 371 pages. Alfred A. Knopf. $23.

title: U.S. Company Investigated in Iraq Arms Buildup
description: Three Government agencies are investigating how an American company was allowed to ship Iraq equipment that was used for building nuclear weapons despite President Bush's assertion during Monday's Presidential debate that no military equipment from the United States had been found in Iraq after the war.

title: One Holdup Too Many as Armed Motel Clerk Kills a Gunman
description: For months someone has been holding up the people who work behind the counters in the fast-food restaurants, bars and motels along Jericho Turnpike.

title: Great-West Lifeco reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.The company said 1992's results included accounting changes that decreased net income attributable to common shareholders by less than 3 cents a share in the 9-month period.

title: Southwest Airlines Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income of $ 12,538,000, or 13 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of change in accounting principle.

title: Yankees Cite Marlins Suit In Their Territorial Claim
description: The New York Yankees are looking at the lawsuit filed against the Florida Marlins by a minor league baseball team and may file one themselves over the eviction of their Fort Lauderdale minor league team.

title: Accounts
description: * Chock Full o' Nuts Corp., New York, named five semifinalists in the review of its account, with billings exceeding $2 million. The New York agencies vying to succeed TBWA Advertising, New York, the company's shop for seven years, are Altschiller Reitzfeld; Backer Spielvogel Bates Inc.; CME KHBB Advertising; Lord, Dentsu & Partners; and Weiss, Whitten, Carroll, Stagliano. A decision is expected next month. * Wendy's Boston ADI Co-op, Wendy's Albany ADI Co-op and Wendy's Hartford/New Haven ADI Co-op to Mintz & Hoke Advertising & Public Relations, Hartford, for local marketing and media placement for 76 restaurants in those markets. The account, with billings estimated at $1.5 million, had been at Lawner Reingold Britton & Partners, Boston, which resigned the account when it merged with Arnold Fortuna Lane & Cabot, Boston, a large McDonald's agency. The merged firm is Arnold Fortuna Lawner & Cabot.

title: Wells Rich Enters Direct Marketing
description: Wells Rich Greene BDDP in New York said yesterday that it had formed its first direct-marketing agency, Bastoni Barnes. The agency is named, naturally enough, for the two women heading the shop, who were named managing partners.

title: Fisher-Price Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
description: b-Reflect change in accounting policy for advertising and merchandising, which increased net income by $ 300,000.c-Reflects accounting changes in advertising and merchandising that resulted in a decrease in net income of $ 2.3 million.Share earnings reflects a 2-for-1 stock split distributed June 1, 1992.The company said for the first 6 months of the 9 months ended Sept. 29, 1991, it operated as a division of Quaker Oats Co., therefore, the reported share earnings are not necessarily indicative of the financial performance of Fisher-Price as a stand-alone entity.

title: Schlumberger Ltd.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included gain of $ 46 million, or 19 cents a share, from the sale of an investment, and partially offset by a charge of $ 25 million for restructuring of the company's North American oilfield operations, in the quarter and 9 months.

title: Events: Mother Goose And Antiques Galore
description: Memories and Memorials New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West at West 77th Street; (212) 873-3400.

title: Economic Scene; Refereeing The Blame Game
description: "THE economy, dummy," reads the now-famous sign in Clinton headquarters, an unsubtle reminder of where the candidate's main chance lies. Even President Bush seems to agree that he has hopelessly botched the recession thing: If re-elected, he has promised to pack his senior economic advisers onto the first Learjet leaving town.

title: A Rocky Off Season Lies Ahead for the A's
description: Their season ended a week ago, but it was not the kind of exit that the Oakland Athletics expected, not for a team that was as close as it gets to a dynasty in baseball these days. They were hooted in Toronto, beaten back by the Blue Jays and ushered out of a return to the World Series with a resounding shove.

title: Soda Maker' Discount Notes
description: The Dr. Pepper/Seven-Up Companies, the country's third-largest soft-drink maker, is offering $656.5 million face amount of senior subordinated discount notes due in 2002. The notes are rated below investment grade and are being offered through BT Securities. Proceeds from the sale, combined with bank borrowings and cash on hand, will be applied to a previously announced recapitalization plan.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-10 GRIM LINK TO EL SALVADOR PAST In a small, rectangular plot among the overgrown ruins of El Mozote, a team of forensic archeologists has opened a window on El Salvador's nightmarish past. Two feet below the ground, a few tiny skeletons grin up almost intact, and other remains indicate what were once at least 38 bodies. A1 WORLD TRADE TALKS FALTER The Bush Administration's lingering hopes for a pre-election breakthrough in world trade talks collapsed when negotiations in Brussels broke down with American and European officials farther apart than before on farm subsidies. A1 BOSNIA DIVIDED INTO 3 PARTS After months of merciless artillery bombardment of virtually every major city and town, Bosnia and Herzegovina has been torn into three ragged mini-states with the Muslim-led forces of the Bosnian Government hanging on in a handful of desperate cities and towns. A1 BOSNIAN OFFERS PLAN FOR PEACE The President of the Muslim-dominated Government of Bosnia and Herzegovina offered a concession in the search for peace by saying he would send a senior military officer to talks on ending the hostilities around Sarajevo. A10 YELTSIN'S FOES READY TO FIGHT The debate over Russia's future has now broken out into the open with a vengeance as an increasingly vocal opposition prepares for a bitter battle over President Yeltsin's program of economic reform. A8 JAPAN GRAPPLES WITH ITS HISTORY Two days before Emperor Akihito begins the first visit to China by a Japanese monarch, Tokyo is once again consumed by a familiar battle over its own history: how to avoid apologizing for Japanese war atrocities, while at the same time appearing deeply apologetic. A9 Israel offers concessions on Golan Heights territory. A3 Militants in Egypt kill a tourist and wound two others. A3 Pretoria rebuked over amnesty for political crimes. A5 Prague Journal: Kafka and Jews in a web he would recognize. A4 National A12-24, B10 UNCHECKED EXPLOITATION A bipartisan commission found that the Federal law enacted six years ago to combat illegal immigration had done nothing to stop the exploitation of migrant farm workers, one of its principal objectives. A1 BUSH HITS HIS STRIDE On a two-day campaign swing through Georgia and the Carolinas, the President seemed finally to have warmed to his message: that Governor Clinton cannot be trusted with the White House. A1 Campaigning in New Jersey, Barbara Bush dismissed the polls. A21 An inquiry on U.S. equipment in Iraq belies a Bush claim. A16 In Flint, Bush has made little gain with the fuel-efficiency issue. A12 The Bush and Clinton camps are tailoring ads for swing states. A20 From Bush and Clinton, more of the same on the drug war. A22 A NEW CONCERN FOR CLINTON Two weeks ago Ross Perot was a footnote to the 1992 race. Now Clinton strategists say their private polls suggest that he is cutting into the Democratic lead in a number of states.A1 The Perot camp is now trying to lure Clinton backers. A21 Gore called for "a revolution" on environment standards. A20 The valedictory tang to the political autumn. A21 On the Trail: Time out for comic relief. A22 In his Wisconsin race, Senator Kasten is rallying. A22 IS THIS MISSION WORTH IT? As Columbia and its six astronauts were declared ready for a 10-day voyage starting today, questions were raised about whether the risks and costs of a shuttle flight were justified given a mission that seems extraordinarily modest. A1 GAIN IN CANCER RESEARCH Stanford scientists said they had increased the immune defenses of nine lymphoma patients with a therapeutic vaccine custom-made from each patient's own cancer. A18 REPORT ON LOS ANGELES RIOTS A municipally appointed study commission found that Los Angeles's government responded dismally to the outbreak of rioting last spring. It recommended a vast overhaul of the Police Department and other city agencies. A12 NEW TURN IN PRIEST ABUSE CASE The Boston Globe reported that the Roman Catholic Diocese of Fall River, Mass., had removed the Rev. James R. Porter from priestly duties at least eight times for sexually molesting children but had repeatedly allowed him to resume parish work after receiving optimistic medical prognoses. He has since been accused of molesting almost 100 children in three states. A12 The slaying of a Vietnamese-born youth resulted in a conviction. A19 Airlines will be ordered to replace part of the wing on the L-1011. A14 Federal employment dipped for the second straight year in 1991. A15 Metro Digest B1 D'AMATO, THE FUND-RAISER As Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato seeks a third term, his continued ability to amass a huge political fund has enabled him to run a fiercely competitive campaign against Attorney General Robert Abrams, who is one of New York State's all-time vote-getters. A1 Home Section C1-15 Master restores stained glass. C1 Pool-hopping with Kelly Klein. C1 De la Renta and Saint Laurent in Paris. C1 Arts/Entertainment C19-28 Draw for Fischer and Spassky in Game 23. C17 "Once Upon a Time in America" will be released uncut. C19 Business Digest D1 Sports B13-20 Baseball: Blue Jays take 3-1 Series lead. B13 Football: Giants drop Walls. B13 Obituaries B12 Editorials/Op-Ed A26-27 Editorials The cold war: get over it. 27 needless deaths. The color of New York's police. Mary Cantwell: Acquired family. Letters William Safire: The fourth man. Leslie H. Gelb: A Bush green light to Iraq? Garry Trudeau: Action report. Tom Brokaw: Save the taiga.

title: Pop and Jazz in Review
description: Vernel Bagneris Michael's Pub 211 East 55th Street Through Nov. 7

title: Bush Campaign Halts Use of Ad Showing Time Cover
description: President Bush's campaign committee said today that it had stopped showing a television commericial that used a Time magazine cover to attack the credibility of Democrat Bill Clinton.

title: THE 1992 CAMPAIGN: Barbara Bush; Bush's 'Secret Weapon' Enters New Jersey Battle
description: Barbara Bush got off the bus from the shopping mall (a charter, the Bush Family Express), shook a few hands outside Bergen County Republican Headquarters on Main Street and then walked inside to attend to business: debunking the polls and attacking Gov. Bill Clinton's record in Arkansas.

title: Ex-Classmate Testifies at Start Of Glen Ridge Sex Abuse Trial
description: The jury in the Glen Ridge, N.J. sex abuse trial heard testimony today from a former schoolmate of both the defendants and the mildly retarded woman the prosecution contends was sexually abused by them in a basement recreation room in 1989.

title: No Headline
description: Maybe if everyone sees these things clearly, they will have to do justice. The Government cannot see all of these children and not want to do justice. -- RUFINA AMAYA, describing massacre victims in El Salvador. [ A1:4. ]

title: The Color of New York's Police
description: The percentage of blacks on New York City's police force falls far below their percentage of the population. That embarrasses the department and feeds tensions between police and communities. The new Commissioner, Raymond Kelly, rightly puts minority hiring at the top of his agenda.

title: F.A.A. to Order Replacement of Part Tied to Crash
description: The Federal Aviation Administration plans to order airlines to replace part of the wings on Lockheed jets like the one that burned on July 30 at Kennedy International Airport after its wing broke under the stress of an aborted takeoff, Government officials said today.

title: If Clinton Wants a Democratic Foreign Policy
description: To the Editor:

title: Equifax Profit Increases 26%
description: Equifax Inc., a leading provider of information for consumer financial transactions, has reported a 26 percent increase in its third-quarter net income to $22.3 million, or 27 cents a share, from $17.7 million, or 22 cents a share in the corresponding period last year.

title: Kelly Services reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Marion Merrell Dow reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings are fully diluted.

title: Tennis Center Expansion Is Scaled Back
description: Concerned by rising costs and vehement opposition from a number of Queens civic groups, the organizers of the United States Open have scaled back their proposed expansion of the tennis tournament's site in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park.

title: Modine Manufacturing Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 26
description: b-Included a gain of $ 1.3 million, or 9 cents a share, from a patent settlement.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Michael Foods reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Action Report
description: People know I'm pretty au courant when it comes to politics, so I get asked a lot of questions about the candidates. I try to take the time to answer as many of them as I can, even though I'm frequently on the go.

description: Screaming Trees and Versus CBGB

description: b-Included $ 42 million tax benefit for the quarter and the 9 months included a charge of $ 805 million from restructuring and net gain of $ 180 million from settlement of natural gas contracts.c-Included charge of $ 75 million for closing of Casper, Wyo., refinery for the quarter and the 9 months included a gain of $ 311,000,000, or 62 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.

title: Calendar: Lectures and Tours
description: Garden Talks Horticultural Society of New York, 128 West 58th Street; (212) 757-0915.
