description: The bidding war for bankrupt Continental Airlines is scheduled to come to a halt on Monday, the court-imposed deadline for formal buyout offers. Four investor groups are known to have made bids to pull Continental from Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, under which it has operated for nearly two years. The bids range in value from $425 million to $385 million, and the winner is expected to get a bargain. Despite the carrier's history of financial problems -- this is its second trip through Chapter 11 in seven years -- Continental has an extensive route structure and $3.5 billion in assets on its balance sheet. Continental yesterday declined comment on whether the four known bidders had changed their proposals since an Oct. 6 flurry of one-upmanship, or whether any new bidders have submitted offers.

title: Pop and Jazz in Review
description: Iris DeMent The Bottom Line

title: CHRONICLE
description: For the 53 years that The Chelsea Clinton News has been published on the West Side of Manhattan, no one has made much fuss about its name.

title: Review/Rock; The Dirty Beat, Loud and Masculine
description: The show at Roseland on Thursday night should have been dubbed Dawn of the New Rock Dudes. Bands from the independent rock world let forth gallons of loud guitar-based music; they shook their manes to the dirty beat and moaned into the microphone. Each of the featured groups made its own version of this smashing noise, and each revealed something different about the connections between youthful masculinity and rock's power.

title: Halloween Eve Is Not the Devils' Night
description: Take your pick: Two goals on the first two shots, or three goals on the first five shots. Either choice portrays a clear picture of the kind of success the Islanders had tonight against the Devils.

title: YOUR MONEY
description: Your Money, a two-page Saturday guide to personal investing and financial planning, begins this week, on page 35.

title: Presidential Politics by the (Phone) Book
description: TO call it a major crossroads in American politics is perhaps an exaggeration, but the fact remains that Bush Street runs into Clinton in the Red Hook section of Brooklyn.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: New York Philharmonic Avery Fisher Hall

title: Perot's Account of Withdrawal Casts Doubts on His Judgment; 'Real Hillary Factor'
description: To the Editor:

title: Stanford Has Chance to Scramble Bowl Picture in a Big Way
description: The giddiness of Bill Walsh's return as coach of the Stanford Cardinal has been replaced by an issue that could affect the top of the college football rankings from coast to coast.

title: New-Home Sales Drop 1%; Consumer Confidence Is Off
description: Ending a pre-election week in which a stream of economic indicators continued to point to stunted recovery, the Commerce Department said today that new-home sales fell slightly in September. In addition, nongovernment bodies found consumer confidence and Chicago-area industrial activity eroding in October.

title: House Speaker Facing A Well-Financed Rival
description: Not since 1860 has a Speaker of the House been defeated for re-election to his Congressional seat. But that has not deterred John Sonneland from spending up to $500,000 of his own money in a bid to make modern history in the home district of Representative Thomas S. Foley.

title: Amy Fisher Allowed to Remain Free on Bail
description: Two days after she was released from the psychiatric ward of Huntington Hospital, Amy Fisher appeared in court today and received good news: She will remain free on bail until her sentencing on Dec. 1 for the shooting of Mary Jo Buttafuoco.

title: Perot's Account of Withdrawal Casts Doubts on His Judgment
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 Congressional Candidates Know They'll Lose, but It's Still Fun
description: Neither has much chance of winning a seat in Congress on Tuesday. If traditions hold, David L. Askren, the Republican challenger to Jerrold Nadler in a heavily Democratic district in New York City will lose by a margin approaching 6 to 1, while David W. Roberts, a Democrat running upstate against a seven-term incumbent Republican, Gerald B. H. Solomon, will fall by 2 to 1.

title: Azinger Is Atop the Leader Board of the Not-So-Rich
description: With the fortunes of the PGA Tour's four millionaires of 1992 dwindling today, Paul Azinger led an uprising of golf's middle upper class to take the lead in the second round of the Tour Championship.

title: New York Presses for State Trial of Clifford
description: A Manhattan prosecutor asked a New York State Supreme Court justice yesterday to reject Clark M. Clifford's request to have state fraud and bribery charges dismissed on the ground he is too ill to stand trial.

title: THE 1992 CAMPAIGN: Campaign Almanac; Countdown to Election Day
description: GEORGE BUSH

title: It Pays to Stick to Basics in Credit Cards
description: With competition rising in the credit card business and more enticements being offered almost every week, consumers should weigh carefully whether the cards they now have are serving their needs at the lowest cost. A switch might save them money.

title: Varig and Delta Team Up On Marketing and Routes
description: Varig Airlines, the biggest carrier in Latin America, plans to sign an agreement with Delta Air Lines under which the two airlines will cooperate in marketing and coordinating their routes.

title: Outlook on Simms a Bit Gloomier
description: Coach Ray Handley said today that Phil Simms's right elbow was not responding to treatment as quickly as the Giants had expected, but that he expected the starting quarterback to return this year.

title: NBC Frees Letterman to Negotiate
description: NBC announced yesterday that it was letting its late-night star David Letterman negotiate with other networks for a future show in exchange for a three-month extension of his current NBC contract.
